title: When an article is sold for Rs. 291, there is a loss of 3%. What will be the selling price of the article, if it is sold at a gain of 8%? - Play with maths - Quora

response.answer_text: For these type of questions always consider Cost Price as 100 then it will be easy to calculate. CP = 100 loss = 3% i.e., 3 so, SP= 97 but they gave SP as 291 We need SP of the article at the gain of 8% Gain of 8% means SP will be 108 Now compare our values with given values If 97 corresponds to 291 then 108 corresponds to ? = 108*291/97 = 324 Hence S.P= Rs. 324

Loss % = (CP-SP)*100/CP. If the SP is Rs.291 and the loss is 3% 3 = (CP-291)*100/CP 3CP = 100CP - 29100 100CP-3CP = 97CP = 29100, or CP = 29100/97 = 300. If the gain has to be 8%, then Gain % = (SP-CP)*100/CP 8 = (SP-300)*100/300, or 2400 = 100 SP - 30000, or 100 SP = 32400, or SP = Rs.324. Answer.
Cost price =291/(1-.03)=291/.97=300. So sale price should =1.08*300=324 Rs.
